q: former-Secretary of State Colin Powell to drive home the criticism. "Don't tell me you're going to freeze to a level," Colin Powell said Sunday on CNN's "State of the Nation." That usually is a very inefficient way of doing it. Tell me what you're going to cut. On top of the spending freeze, Barack Obama also emphasized that he's open to even further cuts as long as "we're not doing it on the backs of our most vulnerable citizens."

employed from the Pentagon lectern. We come upon His Crankiness in a library, doing research for his memoir. When an earnest young man approaches to ask questions, Martin and Stephen Elliott capture Donald Rumsfeld 's disdain: Down there in the kid's eyes, Donald Rumsfeld sees broad leaves of intelligence but rooted in such soft soil that it might as well be sand. A zen garden. With a few green wisps that will blow flat at the first breath of wind. The world they live in is a blustery place. This is the son of a father who never went to war. This is all great fun[!], at least for those who might be rubbing their hands together at the idea of his impending comeuppance, but when Donald Rumsfeld meets his wife and some rather louche friends

. The intention is that they will now be able to pay for tracks immediately, rather than downloading them illegally. David Joseph , the chief executive of Universal Music, told The Guardian newspaper: Wait is not a word in the vocabulary of the current generation. It's out of date to think that you can build up demand for a song by playing it for several weeks on radio in advance. Matt Cardle , the latest X Factor winner who signed to Sony through an agreement with Simon Cowell , sold 439,000 copies of his song When We Collide after it went on sale immediately after the final.

this week crucial. "The one thing you have to do is go on the road and win some games and stay away from prolonged losing streaks," Sixers coach Doug Collins said. All of a sudden, you go into a tailspin and you go from seventh place to 12th. "You've got to protect your home court against teams you're competing against and assure yourself a tiebreaker in case of a tie. All of those things come into play, even though we're not even halfway into the season. As the season wears on, things heat up. the memory of Martin Luther King . Leaving denouncement of his church "sermon" to others, John Archibald tentherism in his inaugural address earlier that day as equally "unnecessary, divisive and blind." As he notes, it was, after all, Martin Luther Day in Montgomery. It was the inaugural, the same event George Will Wallace used in 1963 to wave his "segregation forever' fist at the federal government. Bentley"s words that day "burn like a bad memory," and a worse testament to a seminal American legacy. only did Jay Cutler lead the Chicago Bears passed the Seattle Seahawks, but he did so in impressive fashion. "Of course it starts with Jay Cutler ," Lovie Smith said after the Bears' 35-24 victory. Whether it's running the football or just making the different throws that we ask him to do, he was outstanding today. Jay Cutler was 15/28, for 274 yards. Amarillo for Amber Alert Awareness Day Howard Stern calls Jay Leno a "crook" in interview Piers Morgan Tonight, the shock jock calls the NBC late-night host "insane" and accuses him of stealing sketch ideas. Jay Leno is a crook and the world knows exactly what he's up to. He steals a tremendous amount of material, The New York Post quoted Howard Stern as saying. "This guy's ripped off like 10 major things from my show." Howard Stern also adds he's baffled that Jay Leno has beaten fellow late-night host David Letterman
